subject: Fashion
title: Gibson Girl Ideal
description: A quick win: understand Gibson Girl Ideal.

hook.text: She was the most famous woman in America, and she never existed. An illustrator drew her.

buildup.text: Charles Dana Gibson sketched a tall, confident woman with upswept hair and an hourglass figure.

discovery.text: His drawings in magazines defined beauty for an entire generation. Women copied the look exactly.

twist.text: The Gibson Girl seemed independent, but her image was drawn by a man to sell magazines to men.

climax.text: She was the first mass-media beauty standardâ€”an ideal built on ink, not reality.

punchline.text: The first beauty influencer was a fictional character.

quiz.question: What was significant about the Gibson Girl?
options: She was the first woman to design her own clothing line
She was a real actress who modeled for Vogue magazine
She was a fictional illustration that became the first mass-media beauty standard
